artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Gifuya Seishichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 88.2; Marks, "When the Shogun...," Andon 81 (2007), #16A (53).
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: female figure carrying buckets attached to yoke over her shoulders along a beach; other figures in background with similar buckets; rooftops emerge from rocks; figures on grassy outcropping under trees at L
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Scenes of Famous Sights along the Tōkaidō (Tōkaidō meisho fūkei), also known as the Processional Tōkaidō (Gyōretsu Tōkaidō), here called The Famous Sights along the Tōkaidō (Tōkaidō meisho no uchi 東海道名所之内)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Takashi Bay
